sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand Verapamil Hydrochloride, containing verapamil hydrochloride.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand Verapamil Hydrochloride,
Drug Label for drug brand Verapamil Hydrochloride,

sentence.text: Verapamil should be avoided in patients with severe left ventricular dysfunction (e.g., ejection fraction less than 30% or moderate to severe symptoms of cardiac failure) and in patients with any degree of ventricular dysfunction if they are receiving a beta-adrenergic blocker.

(See DRUG INTERACTIONS. ) Patients with milder ventricular dysfunction should, if possible, be controlled with optimum doses of digitalis and/or diuretics before verapamil treatment (note interactions with digoxin under: PRECAUTIONS ).

mmtx.phraseText: controlled with optimum doses of digitalis

sentence.text: Some patients with paroxysmal and/or chronic atrial flutter or atrial fibrillation and a coexisting accessory AV pathway have developed increased antegrade conduction across the accessory pathway bypassing the AV node, producing a very rapid ventricular response or ventricular fibrillation after receiving intravenous verapamil (or digitalis).

In 120 patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (most of them refractory or intolerant to propranolol) who received therapy with verapamil at doses up to 720 mg/day, a variety of serious adverse effects were seen.
Concomitant administration of quinidine (See Drug Interactions ) preceded the severe hypotension in 3 of the 8 patients (2 of whom developed pulmonary edema).

ellipsisSentence.text: In 120 patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (most of them refractory or intolerant to propranolol) who received therapy with verapamil at doses up to 720 mg/day, a variety of serious adverse effects were seen.

middleSentence.text: Three patients died in pulmonary edema, all had severe left ventricular outflow obstruction and a past history of left ventricular dysfunction.

Eight other patients had pulmonary edema and/or severe hypotension, abnormally high (over 20 mm Hg) capillary wedge pressure and a marked left ventricular outflow obstruction were present in most of these patients.

ellipsisSentence.text: In 120 patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (most of them refractory or intolerant to propranolol) who received therapy with verapamil at doses up to 720 mg/day, a variety of serious adverse effects were seen.

middleSentence.text: Three patients died in pulmonary edema, all had severe left ventricular outflow obstruction and a past history of left ventricular dysfunction.

Eight other patients had pulmonary edema and/or severe hypotension, abnormally high (over 20 mm Hg) capillary wedge pressure and a marked left ventricular outflow obstruction were present in most of these patients.

sentence.text: It has been reported that verapamil decreases neuromuscular transmission in patients with Duchenne"s muscular dystrophy, and that verapamil prolongs recovery from the neuromuscular blocking agent vecuronium and causes a worsening of myasthenia gravis.

mmtx.phraseText: recovery from the neuromuscular blocking agent vecuronium
recovery from the neuromuscular blocking agent vecuronium

sentence.text: Clinically significant interactions have been reported with inhibitors of CYP3A4 (eg, erythromycin, ritonavir) causing elevation of plasma levels of verapamil while inducers of CYP3A4 (eg, rifampin) have caused a lowering of plasma levels of verapamil.

mmtx.phraseText: causing elevation of plasma levels of verapamil
causing elevation of plasma levels of verapamil
a lowering of plasma levels of verapamil.
a lowering of plasma levels of verapamil.

sentence.text: Hypotension, bradyarrhythmias, and lactic acidosis have been observed in patients receiving concurrent telithromycin, an antibiotic in the ketolide class of antibiotics.

mmtx.phraseText: an antibiotic in the ketolide class of antibiotics.
an antibiotic in the ketolide class of antibiotics.

ellipsisSentence.text: Clinically significant interactions have been reported with inhibitors of CYP3A4 (eg, erythromycin, ritonavir) causing elevation of plasma levels of verapamil while inducers of CYP3A4 (eg, rifampin) have caused a lowering of plasma levels of verapamil.

Clinically significant interactions have been reported with inhibitors of CYP3A4 (eg, erythromycin, ritonavir) causing elevation of plasma levels of verapamil while inducers of CYP3A4 (eg, rifampin) have caused a lowering of plasma levels of verapamil.

Clinically significant interactions have been reported with inhibitors of CYP3A4 (eg, erythromycin, ritonavir) causing elevation of plasma levels of verapamil while inducers of CYP3A4 (eg, rifampin) have caused a lowering of plasma levels of verapamil.

sentence.text: The use of HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors that are CYP3A4 substrates in combination with verapamil has been associated with reports of myopathy/rhabdomyolysis.

entity.text: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors that are CYP3A4 substrates

mmtx.phraseText: The use of HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors

sentence.text: Co-administration of multiple doses of 10 mg of verapamil with 80 mg simvastatin resulted in exposure to simvastatin 2.5-fold that following simvastatin alone.
Limit the dose of simvastatin in patients on verapamil to 10 mg daily.
Limit the daily dose of lovastatin to 40 mg.

ellipsisSentence.text: Limit the dose of simvastatin in patients on verapamil to 10 mg daily.

sentence.text: Lower starting and maintenance doses of other CYP3A4 substrates (e.g., atorvastatin) may be required as verapamil may increase the plasma concentration of these drugs.
Concomitant therapy with beta-adrenergic blockers and verapamil may result in additive negative effects on heart rate, atrioventricular conduction, and/or cardiac contractility.

entity.text: additive negative effects on heart rate
additive negative effects on atrioventricular conduction

sentence.text: The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.
However, there have been reports of excess bradycardia and AV block, including complete heart block, when the combination has been used for the treatment of hypertension.

mmtx.phraseText: used for the treatment of hypertension.

ellipsisSentence.text: The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.
The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.
The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.
The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.
The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.
The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.

sentence.text: The combination should be used only with caution and close monitoring.

ellipsisSentence.text: The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.

middleSentence.text: However, there have been reports of excess bradycardia and AV block, including complete heart block, when the combination has been used for the treatment of hypertension.
For hypertensive patients, the risk of combined therapy may outweigh the potential benefits.

ellipsisSentence.text: The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.

For hypertensive patients, the risk of combined therapy may outweigh the potential benefits.

For hypertensive patients, the risk of combined therapy may outweigh the potential benefits.

ellipsisSentence.text: The combination of sustained-release verapamil and beta-adrenergic blocking agents has not been studied.

middleSentence.text: However, there have been reports of excess bradycardia and AV block, including complete heart block, when the combination has been used for the treatment of hypertension.
For hypertensive patients, the risk of combined therapy may outweigh the potential benefits.

sentence.text: Asymptomatic bradycardia (36 beats/min) with a wandering atrial pacemaker has been observed in a patient receiving concomitant timolol (a beta-adrenergic blocker) eyedrops and oral verapamil.

entity.text: Asymptomatic bradycardia (36 beats/min) with a wandering atrial pacemaker

sentence.text: A decrease in metoprolol clearance has been reported when verapamil and metoprolol were administered together.
A similar effect has not been observed when verapamil and atenolol are given together.
Sinus bradycardia resulting in hospitalization and pacemaker insertion has been reported in association with the use of clonidine concurrently with verapamil.

entity.text: Sinus bradycardia resulting in hospitalization and pacemaker insertion

sentence.text: Monitor heart rate in patients receiving concomitant verapamil and clonidine.
Consider reducing digoxin dose when verapamil and digoxin are to be given together.
Monitor digoxin level periodically during therapy.

mmtx.phraseText: Monitor digoxin level periodically during therapy.

ellipsisSentence.text: Consider reducing digoxin dose when verapamil and digoxin are to be given together.

sentence.text: Chronic verapamil treatment can increase serum digoxin levels by 50% to 75% during the first week of therapy, and this can result in digitalis toxicity.
In patients with hepatic cirrhosis the influence of verapamil on digoxin pharmacokinetics is magnified.
Verapamil may reduce total body clearance and extrarenal clearance of digoxin by 27% and 29%, respectively.

In previous clinical trials with other verapamil formulations related to the control of ventricular response in patients taking digoxin who had atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter, ventricular rates below 50/min at rest occurred in 15% of patients, and asymptomatic hypotension occurred in 5% of patients.

Verapamil administered concomitantly with oral antihypertensive agents (e.g., vasodilators, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, diuretics, beta blockers) will usually have an additive effect on lowering blood pressure.

entity.text: additive effect on lowering blood pressure

sentence.text: Patients receiving these combinations should be appropriately monitored.

ellipsisSentence.text: Verapamil administered concomitantly with oral antihypertensive agents (e.g., vasodilators, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, diuretics, beta blockers) will usually have an additive effect on lowering blood pressure.

Verapamil administered concomitantly with oral antihypertensive agents (e.g., vasodilators, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, diuretics, beta blockers) will usually have an additive effect on lowering blood pressure.

sentence.text: Concomitant use of agents that attenuate alpha-adrenergic function with verapamil may result in reduction in blood pressure that is excessive in some patients.

entity.text: reduction in blood pressure that is excessive
reduction in blood pressure that is excessive

sentence.text: Such an effect was observed in one study following the concomitant administration of verapamil and prazosin.

antecedentSentence.Text: Concomitant use of agents that attenuate alpha-adrenergic function with verapamil may result in reduction in blood pressure that is excessive in some patients.

sentence.text: Disopyramide: Until data on possible interactions between verapamil and disopyramide phosphate are obtained, disopyramide should not be administered within 48 hours before or 24 hours after verapamil administration.

entity.text: not be administered within hours before or hours after

sentence.text: Flecainide: A study in healthy volunteers showed that the concomitant administration of flecainide and verapamil may have additive effects on myocardial contractility, AV conduction, and repolarization.
Concomitant therapy with flecainide and verapamil may result in additive negative inotropic effect and prolongation of atrioventricular conduction.
Quinidine: In a small number of patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (IHSS), concomitant use of verapamil and quinidine resulted in significant hypotension.
Until further data are obtained, combined therapy of verapamil and quinidine in patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy should probably be avoided..
The electrophysiological effects of quinidine and verapamil on AV conduction were studied in 8 patients.
Verapamil significantly counteracted the effects of quinidine on AV conduction.

entity.text: counteracted the effects on AV conduction

sentence.text: There has been a report of increased quinidine levels during verapamil therapy.

mmtx.phraseText: a report of increased quinidine levels

sentence.text: Alcohol: Verapamil has been found to significantly inhibit ethanol elimination resulting in elevated blood ethanol concentrations that may prolong the intoxicating effects of alcohol.
Aspirin: In a few reported cases, coadministration of verapamil with aspirin has led to increased bleeding times greater than observed with aspirin alone.
Cimetidine: The interaction between cimetidine and chronically administered verapamil has not been studied.
Grapefruit Juice: Grapefruit juice may significantly increase concentrations of verapamil.
Grapefruit juice given to nine healthy volunteers increased S- and R- verapamil AUC0-12 by 36% and 28%, respectively.
Steady state Cmax and Cmin of S-verapamil increased by 57% and 16.7%, respectively with grapefruit juice compared to control.
Similarly, Cmax and Cmin of R-verapamil increased by 40% and 13%, respectively.

ellipsisSentence.text: Steady state Cmax and Cmin of S-verapamil increased by 57% and 16.7%, respectively with grapefruit juice compared to control.
Steady state Cmax and Cmin of S-verapamil increased by 57% and 16.7%, respectively with grapefruit juice compared to control.

sentence.text: Grapefruit juice did not affect half-life, nor was there a significant change in AUC0-12 ratio R/S compared to control.

mmtx.phraseText: a significant change in AUC0-12 ratio

sentence.text: Grapefruit juice did not cause a significant difference in the PK of norverapamil.

mmtx.phraseText: a significant difference in the PK of norverapamil.

sentence.text: Lithium: Pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic interactions between oral verapamil and lithium have been reported.
The former may result in a lowering of serum lithium levels in patients receiving chronic stable oral lithium therapy.

mmtx.phraseText: result in a lowering of serum lithium levels

ellipsisSentence.text: Lithium: Pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic interactions between oral verapamil and lithium have been reported.

sentence.text: The latter may result in an increased sensitivity to the effects of lithium.

ellipsisSentence.text: Lithium: Pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic interactions between oral verapamil and lithium have been reported.

middleSentence.text: The former may result in a lowering of serum lithium levels in patients receiving chronic stable oral lithium therapy.

sentence.text: Patients receiving both drugs must be monitored carefully.

ellipsisSentence.text: The latter may result in an increased sensitivity to the effects of lithium.

middleSentence.text: The former may result in a lowering of serum lithium levels in patients receiving chronic stable oral lithium therapy.
The latter may result in an increased sensitivity to the effects of lithium.

sentence.text: Carbamazepine: Verapamil therapy may increase carbamazepine concentrations during combined therapy.
This may produce carbamazepine side effects such as diplopia, headache, ataxia, or dizziness.

mmtx.phraseText: carbamazepine side effects such as diplopia,
carbamazepine side effects such as diplopia,

ellipsisSentence.text: Carbamazepine: Verapamil therapy may increase carbamazepine concentrations during combined therapy.
Carbamazepine: Verapamil therapy may increase carbamazepine concentrations during combined therapy.
Carbamazepine: Verapamil therapy may increase carbamazepine concentrations during combined therapy.
Carbamazepine: Verapamil therapy may increase carbamazepine concentrations during combined therapy.

sentence.text: Rifampin: Therapy with rifampin may markedly reduce oral verapamil bioavailability.
Phenobarbital: Phenobarbital therapy may increase verapamil clearance.
Cyclosporine: Verapamil therapy may increase serum levels of cyclosporine.
Inhalation Anesthetics: Animal experiments have shown that inhalation anesthetics depress cardiovascular activity by decreasing the inward movement of calcium ions.

mmtx.phraseText: the inward movement of calcium ions.

sentence.text: When used concomitantly, inhalation anesthetics and calcium antagonists, such as verapamil, should be titrated carefully to avoid excessive cardiovascular depression.
Neuromuscular Blocking Agents: Clinical data and animal studies suggest that verapamil may potentiate the activity of neuromuscular blocking agents (curare-like and depolarizing).

mmtx.phraseText: the activity of neuromuscular blocking agents
the activity of neuromuscular blocking agents

sentence.text: It may be necessary to decrease the dose of verapamil and/or the dose of the neuromuscular blocking agent when the drugs are used concomitantly.

antecedentSentence.Text: Neuromuscular Blocking Agents: Clinical data and animal studies suggest that verapamil may potentiate the activity of neuromuscular blocking agents (curare-like and depolarizing).
Neuromuscular Blocking Agents: Clinical data and animal studies suggest that verapamil may potentiate the activity of neuromuscular blocking agents (curare-like and depolarizing).

sentence.text: Such adverse experiences have not been reported in the literature, despite a long history of use of verapamil HCl in Europe in the treatment of cardiac side effects of beta-adrenergic agonist agents used to treat premature labor.
